dialogues.text: Frazier screeches to a stop in the middle of Columbia Ave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We..."gotta" do nothin'!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna get this on, Joe?     You and me? Or not?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your license?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fight in Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that? What about the Boxing Commission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georgia ain't got no state boxing commission. And Atlanta got a black city council; a liberal Jewish mayor, Sam something. It all set. I do a prelim in Atlanta with Jerry Quarry. But we got to get the steamroller movin' now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I got to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You announce that if I beat Quarry you give me the title shot. (puts it to him) So what you say...maaan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frazier stops in front of his renovated duplex in the Nor Philadelphia ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy was a sharecropper. I worked in a slaughterhouse...right on that corner. I came up from nothing. (raises fist) What I got, I got with this. And I already got the title. So I got nothing to win and everything to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know you ain't the champ yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him) Yeah..."yet." (beat) All right. You beat Quarry, I'll get inna ring and fuck you up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive off.   After a moment, Frazier looks sideways

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quieter) You need any money or anything to tide you by...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns away) I'm fine. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Ali rests a hand on Frazier's shoulder, and they driv off like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sparring. Ali's sweating more than we have seen him sweat before. It's pouring off him. It stains wet his grey sweatsuit. INTO HIS EYES, through the headgear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingham takes pictures. Sarria, Rudy and the media in for are there for the start of Ali's comeback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali spots...a figure step through the door. It's Bundini. Ali, seeing everything all the time, reacts not at all, turns his back. Bundini is thin, drawn, stooped, but clea eyed. Everyone turns. It takes tremendous courage for Bundini to walk to the ring, expecting another rejection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali goes to Angelo in his corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weight's comin' down. 222.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali first acknowledges Bundini.     Ali moves down the ro scowls down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me back, boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to take you back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm clean. (beat) And you a resurrection. This is God's act. Anybody love poor people and little people and fucked-up people gotta be a prophet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the prophet is going home. You the sun. Let me live in the light. (pause) Take me with, boss. (beat) ...I'll do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali considers this man: all jive and bullshit and also hi shaman and resident poet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) You can't hit what you can't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bundini slowly comes alive, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Rumble, young man, rumble!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've entered mid-fight in the second round. We're VERY CLOSE. Quarry has Ali against the ropes. Ali pushes him off. Quarry comes in again. Ali dances, feints and catche Quarry over his right eye with a jab thrown while going backwards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shakes it off. Reorganizes. Throws two jabs, a right to the body and tries to follow it up with a left hook. Ali ties him up. The ref separates them. Quarry comes in agai Ali throws a left cross over Quarry's right, which Ali leaned away from, and adds two rapid, glancing jabs to th same spot. And Ali OPENS A CUT. The BELL sounds, ending Round Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goes nuts, that part that's pro-Ali: Atlanta's black elit and scattered whites. And the thunderous noise becomes on sound, one momentum, cheering their warrior saint, their defiant champion's return. And their ROAR becomes THUNDER...a momentum unto its own, driving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: can't wait for the bell to ring. He sucks in a huge breat through his nose and blows it out. Angelo applies Vaselin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the man! You Superman! Ain't no kryptonite in this ring tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL sounds Round Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past him, hearing him, we ARE him. We think what he think see what he sees. Quarry's corner worked on the cut. Ali feints a left and throws a left cross over Quarry's attem to block it. Quarry comes in again. Ali's next three ripping left jabs almost like karate shots...all with a sharp snap at the point of impact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: streams blood...       Interposing himself between their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stops the fight.       Irish Jerry Quarry damned by skin cuts and bleeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goes nuts! Their champion has returned. ALI throws his arms in the air. QUARRY'S arguing not to have the fight stopped. Now he appeals to Ali!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali knows Quarry's anguish. They embrace. Ali says things to him. And for that moment they are an island. Ali and Quarry, their arms interlocked, are their own tribe. Two pugilists, no longer adversarial, a class unto themselves Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: picked up by Angelo. Bundini's run into the ring.       A arrived. He is coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seated, being examined by Pacheco, his hands still taped. The dressing room's crowded. Belinda enters, embraces her husband. Then Ali hears a familiar voice. He sees Herbert Muhammad, along with the expressionless Joseph 13X and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: another NOI Man, have entered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) ...you don't need their management...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali squeezes her hand...and Herbert quietly comes over. He's nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As-Saalam Alaikum...Brother Muhammad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All praise to Allah... (a beat, and softly...) ...Alaikum Salaam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And people, feeling the awkwardness, give them room...mov out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaming) The Messenger has lifted the suspension, Muhammad. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saying I can be a Muslim again, Herbert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) I never stopped. Like I never stopped being champ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I begged my father to reinstate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? After I promoted Quarry fight? After I won it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get you Frazier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already got Frazier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can get you five million dollars for Frazier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we talking management, talking money or talking religion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupts) When I got leery and talked up how come I'm broke, then came the suspension. Now, you explain that to me, my brother...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts a hand on his shoulder) I love the Nation, Herbert. I love Elijah Muhammad. But it don't own me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herbert's convinced he's getting told "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you go on out. And you make the Frazier deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reversal surprises Herbert; angers Belinda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali stops him, keeps him distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Herbert and Joseph 13X leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You b-b-becoming a Christian? Forgive and forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda stares at him, containing her fury. Ali confronts her look, frankly, then turns to get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and Belinda, with new twin babies; Maryum; Dundee; Pachec Cassius, Sr.; Sarria; and Ali's entourage. They're all around long tables, eating dinner. A large sign over the kitchen counter with "Lana Shabazz' Ten Commandments"...l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: #7 "Anyone bringing guestes in for dinner without prior notice will be awarded thwacks on skull with sharpe objec #8 "Please waite, Rome wasn't burnt in a day; it takes a while to burne the roaste." Lana Shabazz answers a phone and brings it to Ali. Ali's got one of the twins, feeding her a bottle and drinking from it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muhammad, you T.K.O.'ed 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, Howard? Quarry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads) No. "The Supreme Court ruled today in the case of the United States vs. Cassius Clay, a.k.a. Muhammad Ali..." (looks up) You won an 8-0 unanimous decision. You're free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: takes in the news, thanks Howard and hangs up. It is a shining moment after living under the threat of imprisonm for three-and-a-half years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supreme Court set me free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's 'cause they know the king is gonna go home to his throne. And they know everybody's with you, now. And they wanna be on the RIGHT side!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of glitter: the Black royalty of America in their '70's robes. Movie stars 20 rows back. Burt Lancaster is Cosell's color man. Frank Sinatra is working as a still

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: photographer. In the press section are Plimpton types, Schulberg/Mailer types, Lipsyte, Cosell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: descends from the overhead lighting grid.   The announcer hand takes it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, fifteen rounds of boxing for the heavyweight championship of the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALI looking out the hood of his robe, dancing, shaking it out, loosening up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the contender and former heavyweight champion of the world, seeking to regain his title, from Louisville, Kentucky, Muhammad Ali!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catcalls and boos. The other half is a comeback sound. It is a nation divided: pro-war right-wingers, Nixon support are for Frazier; the anti-war movement, celebrities, New York liberal establishment, blacks, Puerto Ricans and hippies are for Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the opposite corner, the current heavyweight champion of the world, Smokin' Joe Frazier...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The contentious roar diminishes only slightly for the ann

dialogues.speaker: ALI'S EYES
dialogues.text: deep in his focused concentration. His attention so arrow like it reminds us of the younger man in the Liston fight...pure purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...only SILENCE as the referee's instructions are given i SLO-MOTION. Ali bounces on the canvas. We HEAR his feet shift, turn, dance...and his breathing, expectant. Here comes the return of what was unfairly taken: his heavywei championship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks swollen,      out of breath. Something's wrong! Two Ali jabs and a      right hook connect. But they slow dow Frazier not at      all. Joe Frazier, short and compact, pit bull, bobs      and weaves his way inside Ali's longe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shouting instructions.        None get through.   Ali loo Older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frazier, off his bobbing and weaving, launches his devastating left hook to Ali's head. Frazier is making th most of what he is: smaller. Ali clinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The referee separates them. Both men throw and miss...Ali on the right, Frazier on the left. Ali throws a hard left that catches Frazier but doesn't stop him. Now Frazier connects with a wild left hook into Ali's cheekbone. THE UNTHINKABLE HAPPENS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is knocked down onto his knee. Ruled a slip, he stands immediately and continues. Ali, backed against the rope again, blocks shots, pushes Frazier into the middle of th ring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: around.     But Frazier cranks his left.     ALI SEES IT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Hook's comin'. Lean back, man! Move back! WORK LEGS...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Ali's legs DON'T work fast enough. Frazier's hook CRASHES into Ali's face. Ali goes rubbery as he backs to the rope. Ali comes out and backs to the rope on the othe side, with cartoon rubbery legs. But the mimicry is camouflage. He really is wobbling. The crowd is going wil We HEAR everything, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is wary. He doesn't trust Ali. He walks across the ring, allowing Ali to recuperate...THE BELL. Ali walks to his corner, drained...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali was out! He was out on his feet. Joe almost had him. Frazier must have thought Ali was playing possum. 'Cause Ali's a clown. Others have come in on Ali when he's playing possum and gotten knocked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali saved himself with GUILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clinch. They separate. They both...as if mirror images of each other...crouch, looking for shots. Ali's right is down. Frazier's right is down. As they both rise up out of the crouch, Frazier's out of the box first. Ali right is coming around. Frazier's left hook slams Ali across the jaw. Ali goes down. Half the crowd ROARS for Frazier. Ali gets right up and stands in the corner and takes the mandatory eight-count. The right side of his fa is swollen like a balloon. They resume...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali takes another right, but the ropes hold him up. Anoth left catches Ali. Frazier's face is a grotesque, swollen mask. He doesn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is exhausted.    Labored breathing.     The crowd cheerin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali drops his arms. He knows he lost. Frazier raises his arms. He knows he won. Half the crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a fight, champ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only have we seen Ali lose for the first time, not on do we see him bruised, but when a fighter's beaten, everybody who believes in him is beaten. Angelo's cutting the tape off his hands. Bundini places an ice pack on the back of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stole it from you! (etc.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bundini's wise enough to say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! I lost. (louder) Get outta here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on!   Everybody out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they leave, the door reveals packed media outside.   D closes. Now it's only the inner circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pacheco) Ferdie, take a look at this... (to Ali) It was still a hell of a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Belinda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fainted... They took her to the aid station. She's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pacheco looks at Ali's hand. It shakes. Pacheco looks at Ali's eyes and has him follow his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hands was in sand, Angie.     My feet in water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we shoulda had more time between Blin and this, you know...to get back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woulda, shoulda, coulda... (pause) After three-and-a-half years, this...from how far back...comeback is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali throws a water bottle. It shatters and splays wet dow the wall. There is mature, deep-seated, dead-serious molt anger. Everybody in the room feels it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Bundini, Bingham, Rudy and Sarria as a wedge, Ali drives through reporters on the way to Belinda. Press mob Ali...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you robbed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost. You lose, you don't shoot yourself. The world goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe said he didn't think you wanted to fight him again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops) Oh, how wrong he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sees Ali...the beating.       She begins crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.    They killed you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali moves to her, followed by Bingham and Pacheco.     A doctor's approaching with a sedative in a syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from her.     What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali leans over, speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't dead, baby!     C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Embracing her, his eyes connect with Dundee. Ali's Suprem Court victory is meaningless. It's drowned by the loss of what the political persecution took from him: his prime, his season that would have been his most brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUR in SLO-MO.       Focus is beyond, to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: starts an arc...or jams towards us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: towards Ali. We PASS crowd, the lighting grid above and SLAM into the side of Ali's jaw, and on the moment of imp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Ali's jaw breaking, shearing, leaving an eighth-inch g in the bone of the lower mandible...and becomes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: taking the shot, covering and assaulting, covering with h left, which he turns into a jab, aggressively going after Norton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fills the frame. Go behind it as they shield Ali spitting blood into a bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can move my jaw with my tongue. He got me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pacheco looks into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) It's broke. I think...I think your jaw's broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Ali spots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: curious about the activity in Ali's corner, starts over..

dialogues.speaker: PACHECO
dialogues.text: nods to Dundee. Dundee starts to reach. Ali snatches Angelo's hand holding the towel. Angelo's about to end th fight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't stoppin' nothin'...! (glares at them) Nothin' stoppin'...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BELL sounds and Ali goes out to fight in an OVERHEAD SH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leave the ring and another defeat, as they move up the ai towards the locker room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching television. The place is a huge mansion on Chicago's South Side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that Smokin' Joe's run out of tomato cans to beat up, I finally got Yank to commit to a rematch with you in about six months. Frazier said he'd be happy with three mil... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll fly to Jamaica and get Yank to sign right after Joe beats this big stiff. (to TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the Frazier-Foreman fight from Jamaica amid th wonderful chaos generated by kids and their toys, who cra all over Ali as if he were furniture. Frazier and Foreman are in the center of the ring... We SEE Don King in Frazier's corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through still-wired- together jaw) Foreman call me one time after he won the Olympics...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Frazier bobs and weaves, ducks and moves like did with Ali. Joe throws a left hook, leaning forward wit it. Before it lands, Foreman unleashes a hard right that jolts Frazier SIDEWAYS. Frazier throws another hook that misses. Foreman hits him with a combination of right and three lefts...two hooks and an uppercut that LIFTS FRAZIE OFF THE GROUND. Ali leans in to SEE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) DOWN GOES FRAZIER! DOWN GOES FRAZIER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frazier stands. The referee does the mandatory eight-coun Foreman bangs Frazier into the corner and blasts him agai Frazier tries to muscle out of the corner. Foreman lifts and throws him back into the corner. Foreman's power is unreal. Frazier is the man who beat Ali. Now, Frazier feints and slides sideways, and Foreman hits him in the b of the head. Frazier goes down again. It is savage. Here is a new world champion: George Foreman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry) B-b-be easy gettin' a Frazier fight now. He ain't the champ of anything except getting knocked down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grabbing. Holding. Ali's got Joe's powerful left tied up this time. A clinch. Separating. A punch. A hook. Clinching. They separate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, having Joe at the right range, hits him. Joe moves i Ali DRAGS him closer and ties him up. They dance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali does a little shuffle, circles to keep Joe at hitting distance, lands a combination. Joe closes, but Ali won't let him in and ties up Joe. We hear a BELL and that's the end of the fight. Not a bang; a whimper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: holds up Ali's hand and mouths silently words we cannot h And as we MOVE CLOSER INTO ALI'S EYES, we see no exaltati This is a victory, but a hollow one. It's a decision eked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inner circle:    Ali, Pacheco, Dundee, Bundini, Bingh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we only eked this one out. And George Foreman makes Frazier look like a sissy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see their fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the Joe Frazier falling- down lesson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Foreman is 24. You are 32 years old. I don't want to see your head get turned into someone's bull's-eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but, you go? We're the corner, same as always. But it ain't gonna be easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Angelo) You think I still got the tools?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the tools, Daddy.     But they different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks; decides: go) Well, you better sharpen 'em up. 'Cause we goin' to Africa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motherland. From the root to the fruit. We gonna rumble...in the jungle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to be heavyweight champion of the world again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Rumble in the Jungle!"     That's the name I given it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and Don King hold court with the press. Also there is George Foreman and his trainer, Dick Sadler, and his mana Nilon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A historical happening. This event will show that the black man has arrived on the world stage. Muhammad Ali and George Foreman in Kinshasa, Zaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where's Zaire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don. Zaire? Why not Antarctica? What's wrong with New York City?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you miss the significance. I dream, as Martin Luther King once dreamt, that a man could be judged by the content of his mind. This is about black men helping black men, overcoming four hundred years of racial depression to the dawn of a new day of liberation...financial and otherwise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King getting really evangelistic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will raise up the spirit of our inner cities. It will rise up and fill with hope the souls, the unrequited needs of the black proletariat, that is, the discouraged, dispirited, denigrated, denizens of the demimonde, that is called...the ghetto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali's looking at him in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don King laughs. As the press digs King...MOVE ONTO Forem and here's what's wrong with all of this...we SEE that Foreman, eight years younger, two inches taller, almost a fast and seemingly twice as strong, is not beatable by Muhammad Ali. Foreman just doesn't hurt you, Foreman can kill you. How is Ali not going to get killed by this man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with death in his eyes and indifference on his face? Meanwhile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten million dollars. With one stroke of the pen, you split the world's biggest emolumation of the history of sports!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali signs a contract; then Foreman.       Flashbulbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Rumble in the Jungle"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don King bursts out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH THROUGH people and SEE an Air Zaire DC-10 pulling in A ramp is wheeled up. The plane stops taxiing. Zairian officials in safari suits, paratroopers with white helmet LT. NSAKALA and hundreds of African, European and America media with cameras and lights approach. The hatch opens. ROAR emerges from the right and left. We don't see the so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda's behind him. Bingham's there, Bundini, Angelo Dundee, Sarria. As they crowd to the door, we're shooting OVER ALI starting down the ramp. He looks up. We don't se what he sees. We see only the crowd of people at the foot of the ramp, including Don King in a dashiki and the crow on the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking ABOVE the receiving party. The ROAR again. He looks side to side, almost distracted from King and the officials. He waves. Distant CROWD ROAR increases. They're chanting something. We don't understand the words It contains his name. Now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are beyond the receiving party. They're on the roof of th airport. They're sitting on balconies and fences. They're waving their arms. They're on every possible horizontal surface that can support weight. They're shouting in unis a syncopated ROAR...his name and something else. Ali move through the receiving party, as if in a trance, to get through the airport to the other side. Security tries to keep up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: emerges and reacts. He's electrified. Dundee, Bingham, an a few cops are with him. Everybody else got left behind. REVEAL 10,000 people are OUTSIDE the airport, cheering hi arrival. Their cheer is thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zairian Official; shouts) What are they saying, man?!!!    Why they saying that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say, "Ali, boma ye. Ali, boma ye."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?!   I don't understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It mean...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't hear) What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has to shout) It mean..."Ali, kill him! Ali, kill him!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali moves forward. The Zairian Official and four cops fad back, nervous about being in so large a crowd. The crowd' a tidal wave, carrying Ali forward, supporting, never mobbing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is overcome. This is all for him. He is their hero. He defied the world's powerful. They tried and could not destroy him. His defiance made him their champion. And no he has come to contest his rightful title against the num instrument of the all-powerful. He raises his arm, too, a shouts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, boma ye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thousand voices carry it on the wind and take away Al breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, boma ye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the rear realize, as do we, this is NOT MERELY A BOXIN MATCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A towering man in denims with sequins blocks our view of door as he walks out onto the ramp. Only now do we see BEYOND HIM a small welcoming party. Native African dancer a big banner that proclaims, "Welcome, George Foreman," t Zairian paratroopers, media and a few dozen of the curiou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks like "Superfly" on steroids. His entourage follows him down the ramp. DICK SADLER, tough and smart, is the Louis Armstrong of trainers. ARCHIE MOORE, crafty and wis wears a blue shirt and blue pea-cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If George Foreman wonders at the paucity of his reception he doesn't let on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sits in EXTREME CLOSE-UP drinking coffee...lost in though He's somewhere else, puzzled, alone in his thoughts. He wears grey sweatpants, a thin-rubber long-sleeved T-shirt under his grey sweatshirt. He's oblivious to the Euro- modern furnishings. Then it's time, and he leaves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters from his bungalow. We SEE we're in a compound. The are white and severely truncated houses linked by sidewal and too many large street lamps. As Ali starts to jog through this imitation of suburbia with the scale all wro It's like a Gulag in reverse for the rich and powerful to within while keeping the rest of the country out. As Ali passes, REVEAL we are at the bank of the Congo River. As Ali starts his predawn run, across the river the first ba of magenta tints the horizon and reflects molten on the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: plus two trainers and the ever-present Zairian POLICEMAN, Nsakala. The early paints the red-earth ochre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Fast. Six left jabs flash from his chest and shoulder, followed by a right hook and left and right uppercuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Back up, maaan... (weaves suddenly; another voice) ...you fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali slides to the right and throws a left jab and hooks o the jab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali ENTERS, running. The road is lined with Mobutu's gree billboards in French and English, proclaiming Zaire wonderful. A few kids emerge from behind the signs, comin out from between...and they trail Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali, boma ye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeating) Ali, boma ye George Foreman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he throws a couple at an imaginary George Foreman. There are 15 to 16 kids, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You out, sucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, Ali runs behind the green signs from where the k came.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still jogging. Behind the signs, he becomes a magnetic attraction. People are surprised to see Ali. He's making their day. Euphoric kids parallel him, run with him, foll him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the concrete-and-cinder-block walls to the dusty, bare ground are chromatic. Primary colors. Ethnographically interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALI SEES interiors. Broken walls. No roof. No plumbing. People come from a ditch with a shower curtain for privac surprised to see Ali. Faces indifferent to squalor. This is the ethnographically "interesting" surface of what, in fact, is civic disintegration starting to occur... It is the human concomitant to 13 years of Mobutu kleptocracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks at the backs of the signs. He and we realize the signs' purpose: to hide the makeshift plastic walls and rooms made from cardboard containers and oil drums from t foreigners traveling the road to Kinshasa. One TEENAGER WITH A WITHERED ARM and a big smile runs up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (broken English) You beat them, Ali!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Foreman?   I kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mimes knocking out Foreman. Something powerful is affecting Ali. We don't know what it is. Ali slows down..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...throws two lightning jabs and a hook. Ali reaches to t kid's head and pulls a coin. He flips it to another kid a walks on. A SECOND TEENAGER comes out and wants Ali to lo at something around the back. He takes Ali's hand...and holds it. Ali complies. The entourage follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an imitation fight poster. Childlike caricatures in Basquiat-like brush strokes. Foreman's got crosses for ey He's out! Ali is victorious! His fist is raised. His cartoon face shouts his victory...the people's champion. There's more. There's knocked-out white policemen, knocke out black soldiers, knocked-out landlords, knocked-out So Africa, knocked-out planes and tanks, knocked-out tse-tse flies...everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much, it means "ALL"...all expectation. This childish painting powerfully affects Ali. The kids look at him. It's still. Some kids in the back leap up in the air to s over taller heads what Ali's doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looks at individual faces. A grinning OLDER MAN with a bl transistor radio (we'll see him later). A smiling kid. A girl with no shoes. A teenage kid jumping up and down...a looking at him. Ali makes four pieces of rope appear. He rubs them together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shazaam!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They become one. Everybody goes nuts. As Ali leaves, his eyes go back to the people and the painting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) ...even if I die here. If it kill me, no matter what...I gotta win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concentration has taken him into the athlete's zone, the state of unified awareness wherein dwells his total self- knowledge. And he knows the transaction: what they give him with their adoration, which he converts to power, is exchange for what he means to them. And what he means to them is specific: he represents them in defying power and vanquishing what oppresses. He validates the existence of expectation, that struggle is possible...George Foreman, mute and unknowingly, represents disinterested power. Ali doesn't "accept" his obligation; he embraces it. It is hi purpose, revealed. And he will never waver from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hell, Muhammad, you got no discretion. You never did. You humiliate me!

dialogues.text: I clean for you. I cook for you. I feel every punch you take.

dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean for it to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to hurt you. It's wrong. You're a good wife to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do you disrespect me this way?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I respect you.   I always respect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda pauses.   A terrible question occurs to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to marry her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I follow my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "You're following your heart"? (sarcasm falls away) That's what you do. No matter what anybody says. Or thinks. Or what it does... (pause) And what happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fight George. (after a beat) I didn't come this far to quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither of us did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali looks at her a moment. Then he leaves. Silence. Belinda sits on the bed. She looks up. Then she comes apart. She rips open a closet. She finds Veronica's clothes, rips them, shreds peignoirs, overturns a night table, strips the bed, smashes more furniture, throws Veronica's suitcase at the mirror. It does not break. She looks around the wrecked room. Bingham is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't beat him. You can't beat him, 'cause you can't not love him.
